FSBA2.utils.searching package¶

Submodules¶

FSBA2.utils.searching.binarysearch module¶

FSBA2.utils.searching.binarysearch.binarysearch(l: list, value, f=None) → bool¶
Parameters:
  • l (list) – list that may contain the value given
  • value – value to be searched
  • f (f(a, b) -> int) – comparator function
Returns:

the boolean value whether the result was found.
Return type:

bool
FSBA2.utils.searching.binarysearch.binarysearch_pos(l: list, value, f=None, lo: int = 0, hi: int = None) → int¶
Parameters:
  • l (list) – list that may contains the value given
  • value – value to be searched
  • f (f(a, b) -> int) – comparator function
  • lo (int) – lower bound of sub-list
  • hi (int) – upper bound of sub-list, inclusive
Returns:

The position / index if value was found, returning -1 otherwise.
Return type:

int

  • value – value to be searched
  • f (f(a, b) -> int) – comparator function

Return type:

FSBA2.utils.searching.linearsearch.linearsearch_pos(l: list, value, f=None) → int¶
Parameters:
  • l (list) – the list that may contain value given
  • value – the value to be searched
  • f (f(a, b) -> int) – comparator function
Returns:

the position of first match of value, returning -1 if not found
Return type:

int
